service

Class JSONValidationService

  • java.lang.Object
    • service.JSONValidationService

  • public class JSONValidationService
extends java.lang.Object
    RESTful web-service for JSON validation.

    This is the main class for using JSON Validation Service (JVS). Its goal is to handle client requests and respond to them whether received JSON is valid (RFC 7159) or some edits should be done in order to get a valid JSON.

    JVS is used by constructing a JSONValidationService instance and then invoking start() method on it. Likewise, to stop the service call stop() method.

    You can create a JVS instance by invoking new JSONValidationService(). In this case the default configuration is used. A configuration can be changed using an instance of JVSOptions class in the overloaded constructor. JVSOption reads jvs.properties configuration file or another file specified in its constructor. If the file cannot be used, it uses predefined parameters. You can also use JVSOptionsBuilder to build a JVSOptions instance with desired parameters.

    Here is an example of how JVS is used for JSON validation: 

     JVSOptions options = JVSOptionsBuilder("example.com", 80).setPath("myapp/path").build();
 JSONValidationService service;

 try {
     service = new JSONValidationService(options);

     service.start();
 } catch (JVSException e) {
     e.printStackTrace();
 }

    As you can see, you have to deal with JVSException which could be thrown if a port number is already in use, a hostname is unresolved and so on.

    Read log messages to retrieve contextual information about service execution. CONFIG level is verbose enough.

      • JSONValidationService

        public JSONValidationService()
                      throws JVSException
        Creates an instance of the class using defaults parameters.

        The method creates an instance of the JSONValidationService class using parameters that are defined by the default constructor for JVSOptions class.

        Throws:
        JVSException - if it is impossible to proceed the creation of the class instance.

      • JSONValidationService

        public JSONValidationService(JVSOptions options)
                      throws JVSException
        Creates a new instance using parameters defined in options.

        The method creates an instance of the JSONValidationService class using parameters that are defined by JVSOptions class.

        Parameters:
        options - JVSOptions instances which holds all the parameters.
        Throws:
        JVSException - if it is impossible to proceed the creation of the class instance.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the service.

        The method starts the JVS service if it was properly constructed.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the service.

        The method stops the JVS service which will wait delay seconds until exchanges have finished.

        See Also:
        JVSOptionsBuilder.setDelay(int)
